gen:ReportedAttribute.com:Text: Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns

12.4 By 2020, achieve environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes throughout their life cycle, in accordance with internationally agreed guidelines, and significantly reduce their release to air , water and soil, in order to minimize their negative effects on health and the environment
12.4.2. Percentage of identified treatment sites are operational before 2018 and the maximum before 2025
Ministry of Transport, Public Works, Equipment and Land Use Planning (MTTPEAT)
Mr KIGABO Marijani SAIDI
Statistical service
Focal point for the production of the Ministry's SDGs
marisaidi212@gmail.com
This is the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites
Percentage
The indicator comes from administrative data
Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
annual
Annual
SETEMU
MTTPEAT Statistical Service
SETEMU is the body recognized by the Burundian government as municipal technical services
This indicator is relevant because it highlights the percentage of functional waste treatment sites compared to all existing waste treatment sites.
The update is annual
Ratio of functional waste treatment sites to all existing waste treatment sites
Annual
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
MTTPEAT Annual Report
Objective 12. Establish sustainable consumption and production patterns
